database_APIs module

database_APIs.add_good()[source]

Add a new good to the inventory.

Returns:

Success or error response.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.charge_wallet(username)[source]

Add funds to a customer’s wallet.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer.

Returns:

Success or error response.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.connect_to_db()[source]

Establish a connection to the SQLite database.

Returns:

SQLite connection object

Return type:

sqlite3.Connection

database_APIs.deduct_good(id)[source]

Deduct a quantity of a good from the inventory.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the good.

Returns:

Success or error response.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.deduct_wallet(username)[source]

Deduct funds from a customer’s wallet.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer.

Returns:

Success or error response.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.delete()[source]

Deletes a customer’s review of a product. Must pass in the post request the user’s username, his password, and the reviewed good.

Returns:

Success message if delete is successful. Error message if submission doesn’t exist or other error occured.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.delete_customer(username)[source]

Delete a customer by username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer.

Returns:

Success or error response.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.flag()[source]

Allows to flag a customer’s review by either a user or an admin. Need to pass in the post request the flag’s value, the reviewed good, and the corresponding username.

Returns:

Success message if flag changed successfully. Error message in case of a problem.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.get_admin(username)[source]

Fetch an admin by username.

database_APIs.get_all_customers()[source]

Fetch all customers.

Returns:

List of all customers in the database or error response.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.get_customer(username)[source]

Fetch a customer by username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer.

Returns:

Customer details or error response if not found.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.get_good(id)[source]

Get a product’s details.

Parameters:

id (int) – The product’s id.

Returns:

If successful, the product’s details. Else, an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.get_good_price(name)[source]

Get a product’s price.

Parameters:

name (str) – The product’s name.

Returns:

If successful, the product’s price. Else, an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.get_goods()[source]

Get all goods with a stock greater than 0.

Returns:

If success, all the available goods. Else, error message in case of a problem.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.get_review(user, good)[source]

Get a customer’s review of a product.

Parameters:

  • user (str) – The username of the customer.

  • good (str) – The reviewed good

Returns:

If successful, the review submitted by the user about the product. Else, an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.get_reviews_product(good)[source]

Get all reviews of a product.

Parameters:

good (str) – The reviewed good

Returns:

If successful, the reviews of the product. Else, an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.get_reviews_user(user)[source]

Get all reviews submitted by a customer.

Parameters:

user (str) – The username of the customer.

Returns:

If successful, all reviews submitted by a customer. Else, an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.perform_transaction()[source]

Register a new transaction. Need to pass in the post request the username, the good, the quantity, and the total cost.

Returns:

Success message if transaction is successful. Else, error message in case of a problem.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.register_customer()[source]

Register a new customer.

Returns:

Success message or error response.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.submit()[source]

Submits a customer’s review of a product. Must pass in the post request the user’s username, his password, the reviewed good, the review, and the rating.

Returns:

Success message if submission is successful. Error message if submission already exists or other error occured.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.update()[source]

Updates a customer’s review of a product. Must pass in the post request the user’s username, his password, the reviewed good, the review, and the rating.

Returns:

Success message if update is successful. Error message if submission doesn’t exist or other error occured.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.update_customer(username)[source]

Update a customer’s details dynamically.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer.

Returns:

Success or error response.

Return type:

flask.Response

database_APIs.update_good(id)[source]

Update details of a good.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the good.

Returns:

Success or error response.

Return type:

flask.Response
